nodes.documentation:
@notice Verifies if the proof sent by the server is valid according to
         the last challenge sent by the client.
         The valid statement will be updated depending on the
         correctness of the proof.
         Internal function, automatically called after the proof is sent

devdoc.author: Lucas GICQUEL

params._i: indicates the i-th bit of the original file to challenge
params._nu: factor chosen by the client making challenge unpredictable

params._file_size: size of the original in bytes
params._u_x: abscissa of a point u used both to sign and verify
params._u_y: ordinate of a point u used both to sign and verify

params._id: identifier of the challenge to return

getChallengesLength().return: the number of all challenges sent

params._id: identifier of the proof to return

getProofsLength().return: the number of all proofs sent

params._sigma_x: Abscissa of the second part of the proof
params._sigma_y: Ordinate of the second part of the proof

devdoc.title: Public Compact Proof of Retrievability Implemantion

challenge(uint256[],uint256[]).notice: Anybody but the server calls this function in order to submit a         new challenge to server. Therefore, the server must answer this         challenge by a corresponding proof.         Adds the given challenge into the Challenge list.

methods.constructor: Called by a client when she wants to store her file in a         distant server.         She sends all metadata in this part allowing the smart contract         to verify the proofs calculated by the server.

getChallenge(uint256).notice: gets the challenge with the identifier given in parameter

getChallengesLength().notice: gets the number of all challenges sent

getProof(uint256).notice: gets the proof with the identifier given in parameter

getProofsLength().notice: gets the number of all proofs sent

proof(uint256[],uint256,uint256).notice: Mathematical answer to the last challenge sent.         This function can only be called by the server.

userdoc.notice: This smart contract is developed for testing purpose only.         There are no rule implemented in this version to secure the         protocol between the client and the server.         Read Compact Proofs of Retrievability for more information.
